170539561.review:
Great game, here's a summary of some of the good and bad:

The Good
[list]
    [*]Left 4 Dead's story is really something else, I really like that each safe house + certain areas have writing on the walls that aid in building the apocalyptic world the survivors are in. There are also comics associated with the game (which takes place inbetween Blood Harvest and The Sacrifice if you want to play in order!) 
    [*]Left 4 Dead 1 maps are included with this, so you get 12 campaigns (+2 non canon ones) off the rip
    [*]This game has one of the greatest workshop communities around it, there's so much you can add into the game that can completely change your experience and make replaying the game more enjoyable

The Bad
    [*] The online community (versus/scavenge/expert realism in particular) is genuinely the worst community I have had the displeasure of interacting with. Racism, whatever other kinds of isms and general toxicity is very common (you'll get votekicked and/or cursed out for making tiny mistakes) which is really a shame as versus and scavenge are both really fun modes. I recommend either getting a group of friends or finding a versus community instead of just jumping into matches because of this.
[/list]

170203742.review:
Oh man where do i begin? L4D2 is the ideal zombie survival game. It forces you to grab all you can, get the best weapon for the situation and survive. but that's only the first part. teamwork is integrated perfectly from, teammates saving you from special infected to giving you pills for wounds. and the zombies...holy shit the zombies...its designed to be so satisfying when you kill them, considering there's hundreds of death animations making the immersion even MORE real. The mechanics and design aged like the finest of wine, even more than a decade after its release it still feels spectacular. And I've been seeing people telling me "oh its not realistic enough, most of the shotguns are fired rapidly, it should be way easier to die by special infected...now normally i wouldn't care...BUT THERE'S LITERALLY A GAMEMODE THAT MAKES THE GAME MORE REALISTIC. seriously if you love killing zombies, and team building, this game is for you.




also it has coach, that automatically makes it a 10/10

171601530.review: I ever tell you about the time my buddy Keith made sushi? Yeah, his mom took him to a sushi place for his birthday and he didn't want to go, but he turned out he LOVED it, man. But it's like 10 bucks a sushi in one of them places, so Keith figures, "Hey, how hard can it be to roll up some raw food in seaweed," right? As it turns out, it's hard. Now, they say experience is the best teacher, and experience taught Keith that if you ever eat three pounds of raw chicken, it kills you. Now luckily, Keith's brain went into self-defense mode and started shutting organs down to head the chicken off at the pass, and the doctors were able to get 'em out before his heart stopped. But to this day, Keith has no sensation in his right foot, and he doesn't recognize his own brother Paul no more.

171188943.review:
15yrs later and Left 4 Dead 2 is still a very fun cooperative multiplayer zombie game. Its always nice to get off from a long day at work and to quickly find a match going. The various modes, especially the Versus mode, still holds up. There usually always a game going on or a lobby being started. You can find a match or lobby within 10 seconds of booting up. The dopamine hit after you setup a nice insta kill with the Charger is amazing! There very few coop games like L4D2 that still hold up.

But whats not nice is the in-game "community" and the constant DDOS attacks on the servers that seem to happen every two months nowadays. Saw a comment the other day that said the L4D2 community is stuck in the 2009 Call of Duty online era and this is very much true. Constant instant kicks from sessions for newer players and players who make simple mistakes while in game. The use of racism is treat as the norm and if you make it known you're not ok with being a terrible Human being, you're in the wrong and will be kicked. I recommend not playing this when a small kid is in the room or at the least turn the option to see sprays off as there are many players who have sprays that feature pornographic images. And not sure when it started but since last year, the servers have been under attack for what seems like every month or so by hackers. Valve puts out patches when they can but the game is old and ripe for new hacker exploits.

Despite most of my review focusing on the negative of the community, the game is still very fun to play with friends when there no issues.

170885133.review:
I didn't realize I never wrote a review for this, but there IS a reason why on every computer shop in SEA, L4D is a readily available game, and why even on such an incredibly cheap price tag it's still wildly popular.

It is one of the granddaddies of zombie shooter, and almost every other zombie game that comes after will always be compared to L4D2. It's just THE defacto zombie game.

If you have not played it, it's still worth a buy even in 2024. The gameplay is classic, and the animations and looks can easily be changed using workshop mods to have it be more modern (or wild depending on your taste).

170516091.review:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a game that takes the zombie apocalypse and turns it into a hilarious, adrenaline-fueled, and occasionally frustrating adventure. It's like a rollercoaster ride, but instead of screaming with joy, you'll be screaming at your teammates for being idiots.

The game is set in the southern United States, where you and your team of survivors must fight your way through hordes of infected to reach safety. It's like a road trip, but instead of stopping for gas, you stop to shoot zombies in the face.

The gameplay is fast-paced and intense, with a variety of weapons at your disposal, from shotguns to chainsaws. It's like a buffet, but instead of food, you're choosing which way you want to kill zombies.

The infected are varied and terrifying, with special infected like the Witch, who will make you wish you had never been born. It's like a horror movie, but instead of hiding under the covers, you're hiding behind your teammates.

The game also features a dynamic AI director that changes the game's difficulty based on your performance. It's like a sadistic game show host, always trying to make things harder for you.

But what really sets Left 4 Dead 2 apart is its sense of humor. The game is filled with funny dialogue, quirky characters, and hilarious moments that will have you laughing out loud. It's like a comedy show, but instead of a laugh track, you have the screams of your teammates.

In conclusion, Left 4 Dead 2 is a must-play for anyone who loves zombie games, humor, and a good challenge. It's like a rollercoaster ride through a zombie apocalypse, and you'll be screaming with laughter the whole way. So grab your friends, stock up on ammo, and get ready for the most epic and hilarious zombie adventure of your life. 

Left 4 Dead 2 is like a buffet of zombie apocalypse goodness, and the mods are like the extra toppings that make it even more delicious! 🍔🍕

First, let's talk about the character mods. Who wouldn't want to blast zombies with the power of anime girls or the might of Madoka Magica? 💥🎎 It's like a crossover episode of "The Walking Dead" and "Sailor Moon," and I'm here for it!

And speaking of crossovers, how about replacing the survivors with the cast of "The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time"? 🎮🎵

171253104.review:
Gunplay is amazing, it's great with friends and its ok-ish in single player. On top of all that the game is just insanely really cheap. Tension from the use of music, multiple dark environments and the threat of special infected that will make you trust your teamwork. I also love that it also features the campaign from the previous game (Left 4 Dead) with improved visuals. The game may lack narrative, but all the fun and innovation makes up for it. Some might consider this the best zombie game of all time, I wouldn't say that, but I had a lot of fun achieving 100% of the game.

I will give it 9 out of 10.

171950935.review:
**Left 4 Dead 2 리뷰: 좀비, 혼란, 그리고 궁극의 팀 빌딩 운동!**

친구들과 아마겟돈의 스릴을 경험하고 싶었던 적이 있다면, 탱크를 치료하는 것을 잊은 사람에 대해 말다툼을 하는 동안, "Left 4 Dead 2"보다 더 좋은 곳은 없을 것입니다. 이 게임은 지루한 강의가 없고, "앗, 내가 네 등을 쏴버렸어"라는 순간이 넘쳐나는 좀비 종말 생존 코스와 같아서 아드레날린이 솟구치고 관계가 흔들리지 않습니다!

**그래픽: 7/10(추가 스플래터 포함!)**
물론, 좀비의 두개골이 프라이팬에 쪼개지는 방식으로 그래픽이 최첨단은 아니지만, 그들은 완벽하게 일을 해냅니다! 언데드는 익은 토마토의 모든 영광으로 렌더링되고, 롤러스케이트를 탄 유아의 모든 우아함으로 비틀거리는 모습을 좋아할 것입니다. 피투성이 발레와 같고, 솔직히 언데드와 멋진 춤을 추는 것을 누가 싫어하겠습니까?

**게임 플레이: 9/10 (팀워크가 꿈을 실현합니다... 어느 정도!)**
다음은 특종입니다. "Left 4 Dead 2"는 우정에 대한 궁극적인 시험입니다. 이 게임은 당신과 당신의 친구 3명이 "바닥은 용암" 게임처럼 좀비의 물결에서 살아남으려고 노력하는 전략적 걸작입니다. 다만 바닥은 썩은 살점으로 뒤덮여 있고 용암이 물립니다. 당신은 "탱크 조심해!"라고 소리치며, 그 순간 당신은 친절을 베풀 기분이 아닌 마녀 옆에 서 있다는 것을 깨닫게 됩니다. 뜨거운 양철 지붕 위의 고양이 무리처럼 미친 듯이 달려들게 됩니다!

사용할 수 있는 무기의 홍수는 말할 것도 없습니다. 야구 방망이에서 유탄 발사기까지, 마치 파괴의 달콤한 뷔페와 같습니다! 잘 배치된 몰로토프 칵테일로 팀원을 "실수로" 날려버릴 수 있을 때 누가 계획이 필요하겠습니까? 고전입니다!

**캐릭터: 8/10(풍자 A팀)**
캐릭터는 각자 독특한 개성을 가진 다채로운 생존자입니다. 말 그대로 거대한 테디베어인 코치, '나는 이렇게 일어났어'라는 태도를 보이는 닉, 정육점보다 더 용기 있는 건방진 기자 로셸, 그리고 사실상 걸어다니는 남부 매력 공장인 엘리스가 있습니다! "좀비가 왜 이렇게 많은 거야?!"라는 당황한 비명 사이에 그들의 농담에 웃음이 터질 것입니다.

**사운드 디자인: 10/10(이어 캔디와 언데드 으르렁거림)**
사운드 디자인은 흠잡을 데 없습니다! 총격? 확인. 좀비가 포장도로에 떨어지는 만족스러운 소리? 다시 한 번 확인하세요. 게다가 언데드의 신음소리와 으르렁거림은 공포의 교향곡을 만들어내 부활한 시체에 둘러싸여 있는 동안 그 어느 때보다 더 생생함을 느낄 수 있도록 합니다. 지뢰밭 피하기 게임을 하는 것처럼 발끝으로 걸어다니게 하는 상징적인 "마녀" 사운드는 말할 것도 없습니다. 울음소리가 들리면 즉시 얼어붙어 그녀를 위로할지 불태울지 확신할 수 없을 것입니다.

**결론: 9/10(좀비 아포칼립스 테라피)**
요약하자면, "Left 4 Dead 2"는 미친 세상을 헤쳐나가는 유쾌하고 혼란스러운 모험으로, 뇌를 튀기는 액션만큼이나 웃음이 가득합니다. 팀워크, 무기, 부조리의 놀라운 조합으로 우정을 강화하거나 완전히 산산이 부술 것입니다. 좀비가 당신을 쫓기 시작하면 가장 좋은 전략은 빨리 달리고 친구가 당신보다 느리기를 기도하는 것입니다!

그러니 소다 캔(또는 필요하다면 건강 팩)을 챙기고, 친구들을 모아 좀비가 들끓는 혼란 속을 헤쳐나갈 준비를 하세요! 다만 다른 생존자들을 주시하는 것을 잊지 마세요. 결국, 좀비 대신 프라이팬으로 당신을 때리기로 결정할 때가 언제인지 알 수 없습니다. 즐거운 사냥 되세요!

170277856.review: Left 4 Dead 2 stands as a titan among cooperative multiplayer games, unmatched in its blend of relentless action and strategic teamwork. Set against a post-apocalyptic backdrop teeming with hordes of the infected, this game challenges players to navigate treacherous environments while coordinating with teammates to survive the onslaught. Its dynamic AI Director ensures every playthrough is unpredictable, ramping up tension with swarms of enemies and scarce resources. The game's diverse arsenal, from shotguns to molotov cocktails, allows for varied combat styles, while its memorable characters inject personality into the chaos. Whether navigating the streets of New Orleans or escaping through a decaying carnival, Left 4 Dead 2 delivers an adrenaline-pumping experience that keeps players hooked, making it a timeless masterpiece in cooperative gaming.

170069107.review: Despite its age it still holds up really well and is the most fun game I had played

171927356.review:
This was the zombie game I was looking for my entire childhood. If I had had an XBOX 360 instead of a PS3 growing up as a kid, I would have been playing this game constantly. This game makes you feel like you're in a zombie movie, down to the little movie references and the structure of the campaigns themselves. That, along with the memorable characters, give it a unique charm that so many other games lack. This game is a blast as long as you decide to not abuse god-spots, as the game director does everything it can to ensure that you aren't too powerful. The official campaigns are well-designed and it's clear that they've been thoroughly playtested. The only way to be truly overpowered is to have teammates that you're in close coordination with. Usually, though, people are screwing around, which means that even with a full team of four, things can still be intense. This game also has an insane amount of mods. Don't like the existing scripts, models, songs, or textures? Replace them. Want more maps? There are hundreds of modded maps to choose from. This game is essentially fully customizable through the Steam workshop. Oh, and this game isn't going to take up 100+ GB of space, so that's nice. Despite the ridiculously low price, you're getting a far superior zombie game than anything that has released since. It's been over 15 years since this game came out, and nothing has been able to surpass it.

I haven't touched Versus mode yet, though, so we'll see how that goes.

170335605.review: I am a 54 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2023 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories. Thank you

166167003.review: What more can be said about this Valve classic from the golden era? This game has won every award for its co-op gameplay. The fact that it still routinely figures among the top 50 most played games on Steam 15 years after release, despite having received very few significant updates, speaks volumes about how loved it is. This ongoing success has no doubt been facilitated by the authoring and hosting tools Valve has made available, the fact that it can be had for a few dollars during Steam sales, and that it runs on a toaster. From the perspective of 2024, the graphics are dated, and the hit detection has never been great. Still, I regularly play despite having hundreds of modern games in my Steam library. None can replicate the atmosphere and online gameplay moments that this game continues to offer.

169425667.review:
Gunplay is amazing, it's great with friends and its ok-ish in single player. On top of all that the game is just insanely really cheap. Tension from the use of music, multiple dark environments and the threat of special infected that will make you trust your teamwork. I also love that it also features the campaign from the previous game (Left 4 Dead) with improved visuals. The game may lack narrative, but all the fun and innovation makes up for it. Some might consider this the best zombie game of all time, I wouldn't say that, but I had a lot of fun achieving 100% of the game.

I will give it 9 out of 10.

[h1] 6/10 [/h1]
A good and fun game to play, this FPS game offers an intense experience with fast and action-packed gameplay, requiring players to work together well and use their abilities to fight zombies, but there is something I don't like about this game, namely because it in this game there is a Friendly Fire feature which makes the gameplay inconsistent, especially in Campaign and Survival modes in multiplayer, when the game starts or at a checkpoint suddenly my partner shoots and kills me for no apparent reason, even though I didn't do anything bad to them and it has happened so many times that it makes me frustrated.

This game would be better if Friendly Fire was removed or at least disabled in several modes in multiplayer, a game that is supposed to require cooperation to survive against zombies but is actually the opposite.

A chic action shooter with a third-person view in the style of survival during the zombie apocalypse. The game is designed for four players to play together. However, you can go through the company alone. The missing live players will be replaced with bots. You will have to fight here against an army of rabid zombies, among which there are bosses – special infected ones: A hunter capable of climbing walls and suddenly attacking, a Smoker monster with a tongue several tens of meters long, a fat man – a walking bubble with rot, when exploding, liquid splashes and attracts small infected, a Tank – a muscular creature capable of Rushing cars and a Witch. It is better not to touch the latter, otherwise it will tear everyone to pieces.
In this game there is something to shoot from, and take off the heads of all the walking dead. A pump-action shotgun, an Uzi submachine gun, an M-16 assault rifle, a sniper rifle, a shotgun and a pistol – from all this stuff you can shoot at the living dead. In addition, there are bombs in the game

167409838.review:
Left 4 Dead 2, developed and published by Valve, is a cooperative first-person shooter that has become a staple in the multiplayer gaming community since its release in 2009. The game builds upon the foundation laid by its predecessor, offering intense, fast-paced action in a world overrun by zombies. This review explores the core gameplay mechanics, cooperative elements, atmosphere, and enduring appeal of Left 4 Dead 2.

Gameplay:
Left 4 Dead 2 excels in delivering a thrilling and engaging co-op experience, focusing on teamwork and survival against relentless waves of zombies.

Campaigns and Missions: The game features five expansive campaigns, each with unique settings and narratives. Players progress through various levels, from urban environments to rural swamps, battling hordes of zombies and special infected.

Cooperative Play: The game is designed for up to four players to work together, emphasizing the importance of communication and coordination. Solo players can also play with AI companions, but the true magic of the game shines in multiplayer mode.

Special Infected: In addition to standard zombies, players must contend with special infected enemies like the Tank, Witch, Smoker, and Boomer, each requiring different strategies to defeat. These enemies add layers of challenge and excitement to the gameplay.

Graphics and Performance:
Though Left 4 Dead 2 is over a decade old, it remains visually appealing and runs smoothly on a wide range of systems.

Visuals: The game utilizes the Source Engine to deliver detailed environments, realistic lighting, and dynamic effects. Despite its age, the art style and atmosphere hold up well, providing a sufficiently creepy and immersive experience.

Performance: Left 4 Dead 2 is well-optimized, ensuring stable performance even on lower-end hardware. Regular updates and community mods have also helped maintain its technical integrity over the years.

Atmosphere and Design:
The game's atmosphere is a standout feature, combining horror and action elements to create an engaging experience.

Level Design: Each campaign is meticulously designed, with varied environments that keep the gameplay fresh and challenging. The dynamic AI Director adjusts the difficulty and pacing based on players' performance, ensuring each playthrough is unique.

Sound Design: The sound design is exceptional, with ambient noises, eerie music, and distinct sound cues for different types of infected. This auditory feedback is crucial for gameplay and heightens the tension.

Community and Support:
Left 4 Dead 2 boasts a dedicated and active community, contributing to its long-lasting popularity.

Mods and Custom Content: The Steam Workshop integration allows players to create and share custom campaigns, skins, and mods, significantly extending the game's replayability. The community content ranges from new maps to entirely new gameplay modes.

Developer Support: Valve has consistently supported the game with updates and patches, ensuring it remains relevant and enjoyable. The recent "The Last Stand" update, created in collaboration with the community, added new content and improvements.

Longevity:
Left 4 Dead 2’s enduring popularity is a testament to its solid design and engaging gameplay.

Replayability: Exceptionally high. The combination of dynamic AI, varied campaigns, and extensive mod support ensures that no two playthroughs are the same.

Future Prospects: With a strong community and continued interest from both players and developers, Left 4 Dead 2 is likely to remain a staple in the cooperative shooter genre for years to come.

Conclusion:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a masterclass in cooperative first-person shooter design, offering intense, satisfying gameplay that rewards teamwork and strategy. Its blend of horror and action, coupled with a dedicated community and extensive mod support, makes it a timeless classic.

Pros:

Intense and engaging cooperative gameplay
Varied and well-designed campaigns
High replayability with dynamic AI and community mods
Strong atmosphere and sound design
Cons:

AI companions can be inconsistent
Older graphics compared to modern titles
Final Verdict:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a must-play for fans of cooperative shooters and zombie games. Its thrilling gameplay, atmospheric design, and enduring community support make it a standout title that continues to deliver excitement and challenge, even years after its release. Whether you’re teaming up with friends or diving into the chaos solo, Left 4 Dead 2 offers an unforgettable experience.

169300463.review:
To be precise : ITS AMAZING!!

The L4D series are one of the best post apocalyptic games and guess what its even amazing to play the game in multiplayer mode.

I have been a great fan of L4D, me and my brother(both of us are game fanatics) used to play the game on weekends connecting my laptop with his laptop using cable and playing in multiplayer mode. We 2 used to take a role each and the remaining 2 would be the AI's. And going from one location to another Killing Hoard of Zombies, Killing Boomers, Hunters, Smokers, Witches and the mighty Tanks. That would be an amazing feeling.

We would shout in our rooms Maar Use(Kill that).

The game would be more amazing if all the 4 players are operated by Humans. Always played the game in the most difficult mode. That was the best way to play the game.

The game would become more interesting when my cousins or friends used to come over. We would split the screens in my as well as my brothers Laptop into 2 for accommodating 4 players. Use mouse for 1 player and joystick for another in each laptop. We all would take each role and play the game. Those were the times when we used to assault the Witch as opposed to never startling her. Coordinating together, watching each others backs, killing hoards of zombies and moving from one safehouse to another, and of course giving medipacks to each other when in need.

Its an AMAZING game indeed with AMAZING feeling of playing it on multiplayer mode.
